duties_responsibilities.duty: Develop and administer personnel procedures for Unit 3 and Unit 11 as per Collective Bargaining Agreements, policies, and statutes.
Oversee the administration of collective bargaining agreements for faculty and academic student employees.
Provide regular training on CBAs and policies related to academic personnel issues.
Interpret, develop, and disseminate policies related to academic personnel issues.
Investigate, hear, and prepare responses to grievances in compliance with CBAs.
Liaise with various stakeholders on academic personnel matters and manage professional staff in employee relations matters.
Participate in the preparation/review of mandated reports/responses to external agencies.

education_certification.credential: Advanced Degree in labor/employee relations, human resources management, public administration, business administration, organizational planning/policy, or a related field; Bachelor’s degree with 5-7 years administrative and/or supervisory experience may substitute for advanced degree 3-5 years’ administrative and/or supervisory experience interpreting and/or applying collective bargaining agreements (preferably in an academic environment), including processing grievances and conducting investigations
